result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Lee Marek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 09/19/22
- 31 days against ultimate sentence
- If in 1 year, Defendant has completed all programing and no violations, Court has no objection to end probation after 1 year probation.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 22CM400 Count 2 without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation Revocation

miscConds.notes:
- $243.00 Court Costs, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CM400 Count 1. 
- $200.00 DNA Surcharge, Payable through DOC as a condition of Probation in 22CM400 Count 1.

- DNA Sample
- Absolute Sobriety
- Test randomly and regularly
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- No Abusive Contact with J.S.
- No Contact with B.C
- Finish Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT)
- Pay Supervision fees
- Defendant to continue to make monthly payments for attorney fees

8:09 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Gregory Lee Marek in court.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Gregory Lee Marek.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Ballo states there is an agreement and recites joint recommendation. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to AMENDED Ct 1- Disorderly Conduct and G to Ct 2- Disorderly Conduct in 22CM400. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 & 2 in 22CM400. On motion of the State without objection. Sentencing arguments.   

Court Orders: AMENDED Ct 1

S/W 18 Months of Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 
If a year from now and programs are completed and no violations, no objection to end probation after a year. 

- Court Costs: $243.00    
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
  Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Court Orders: Ct 2

S/W 18 Months of Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 
If a year from now and programs are completed and no violations, no objection to end probation after a year. 

- Court Costs: $243.00    
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
  Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Test randomly and regularly 
- Complete any additional programming agent thinks is necessary
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Absolute sobriety
- No Abusive Contact with J.S.
- No Contact with B.C.
- Finish Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT)
- Pay supervision fees
- DE to continue to make monthly payments for attorney fees
- Sign up for probation by today, 9/19/22

31 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 8:36 AM. bph

for release/ modification/ change in sentence. Filed by DE. arc   Per SRN on 07/07/22. DENIED.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brittney C. or Jennifer S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from residence in the presence of law enforcement.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:34 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow with Student Intern Connor Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gregory Lee Marek in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Gregory Lee Marek for today. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG. Bond argument; bond ordered. Settlement conference to be held prior to 8/10/22.
